Name: Cleave
Content: When you cleave armored foes at close range, mark exhaustion and roll with Might. On a hit you smash through their defenses and equipment; inflict 3-wear. On a 7-9, you overextend your weapon or yourself: mark wear or end up in a bad spot, your choice.

Name: Confuse Senses
Content: When you throw something to confuse an opponent's sesnses at close or intimate range, roll with Finesse. ON a hit, you've thronw them off balance, blinded them, deafened them, or confused them, and given yourself an opportunity. On a 10+, they have to take some time to get their bearings and restore their senses before they can act clearly again. On a 7-9, you have just a few moments.

Name: Disarm
Content: When you target an opponent's weapon with your strikes at close range, roll with Finesse. On a hit, they have to mark 2-exhaustion or lose their weapon — it's well out of reach. On a 10+, they have to mark 3-exhaustion instead of 2.

Name: Harry a Group
Content:
When you harry a group of enemies at far range, mark wear and roll with Cunning. On a 10+, both. On a 7-9, choose 1:
• inflict 2-morale harm
• they are pinned or blocked

Name: Improvise a Weapon
Content: When you make a weapon out of improvised materials around you, roll with Cunning. On a hit, you make a weapon; the GM will tell you its range tag and at least one other beneficial tag based on the materials you used. On a 7-9, the weapon also has a weakness tag.

Name: Parry
Content:
When you try ot parrty the attack of an enemy at close range, mark exhaustion and roll with Finesse. On a hit, you consume their attention. On a 10+, all 3. On a 7-9, pick 1.
• you inflict morale or exhaustion harm (GM's choice)
• you disarm your opponent; their weapon is out of hand, but in reach
• you don't suffer any harm

Name: Quick Shot
Content:
When you fire a snap shot at an enemy at close range, roll with Luck. On a hit, inflict injury. On a 7-9, choose 1. On a 10+, choose 2.
• you don't mark wear
• you don't mark exhaustion
• you move quickly and change your position (and, if you choose, range)
• you keep your target at bay—they don't move

Name: Storm a Group
Content:
When you storm a group of foes in melee, mark exhaustion and roll with Might. On a hit, trade harm. On a 10+, choose 2. On a 7-9, choose 1.
• you show them up; you inflict 2-morale harm
• you keep them off-balance and confused; you inflict 2-exhaustion
• you avoid their blows to the best of your ability; you suffer little (-1) harm
• you use them against each other; mark exhaustion again and they inflict harm against themselves

Name: Trick Shot
Content:
When you fire a clever shot designed to take advantag eof the environment at any range, mark wear and roll with Finesse. On a 7-9, choose 2. On a 10+, choose 3.
• your shot lands in any target of your choice within range, even if it's behind cover or hidden (inflicting injury or wear if appropriate)
• your shot strikes a second available target of your choice
• your shot cuts something, breaks something, or knocks something over, your choice
• your shot distracts an opponents and provides an opportunity

Name: Vicious Strike
Content: When you viciously strike an opponent where they are weak at intimate or close range, mark exhaustion and roll with Might. On a hit, they suffer serious (+1) harm and cannot mark wear on their armor to block it. Ona  10+, you get away with the strike. On a 7-9, they score a blow against you as well.
